# Base64 Encoder Decoder
Base64 Encoder Decoder
C# Base64EncodeDecode Base64 encoding schemes are commonly used to encode binary data to use in any ascii formatted files. Base64 is commonly used in a number of applications including email via MIME, and in storing complex data in XML. One common application of base64 encoding on the web is to encode binary data so it can be included in a data: URL.

Example:

<link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="16x16" href="data:image/png;base64, " />
this is exactly same as <link rel="icon" type="image/png" sizes="16x16" href="test.ico" />

Only difference is, the ico file is base64 encoded and embedded in html file. All in one. You can use it in email signatures and in many different cases.
